extendedIngredients.name: cooked wild rice
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2½ C cooked wild rice, cooled (I used quick wild rice)

extendedIngredients.name: extra virgin olive oil
extendedIngredients.originalString: ¼ C extra virgin olive oil

extendedIngredients.name: kale
extendedIngredients.originalString: 3 C baby kale, stems removed and torn into pieces

extendedIngredients.name: pepitas
extendedIngredients.originalString: ¾ C pepitas (lightly salted or no salt)

recipes.title: Harvest Wild Rice Salad with Pumpkin Vinaigrette

winePairing.pairingText: Chardonnay, Gruener Veltliner, and Sauvignon Blanc are great choices for Salad. Sauvignon Blanc and Gruner Veltliner both have herby notes that complement salads with enough acid to match tart vinaigrettes, while a Chardonnay can be a good pick for creamy salad dressings. The Ghost Pines Sonoma County Napa County Monterey County Chardonnay with a 5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 27 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Ghost Pines Sonoma County Napa County Monterey County Chardonnay
productMatches.description: Selected from three of California's most recognized Chardonnay appellations, Sonoma, Monterey and Napa, our Ghost Pines Chardonnay offers expressive, fruit-forward characteristics. The artful combination of these three regions delivers baked apple, pear and lemon cream flavors, accented by an elegant finish of sweet vanilla.

recipes.instructions: Preheat your oven to 350. Line a baking pan with aluminum foil. Place the chopped pecans into the pan and lightly spray with cooking spray. Toss to coat. Bake for 3 minutes and then stir. Bake for 3 more minutes. During the last 3 minutes of baking, watch the pecans to make sure they do not start to burn. If they start to brown a lot, remove them from the oven. Once done baking, remove from he oven and set aside to cool.Heat 1 tsp of olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the baby kale to the skillet and saute for 1-2 minutes. Remove from the skillet and set aside to cool.In a mixing bowl, toss together the wild rice, dried cranberries, pepitas, pecans and baby kale. Set aside.Make the dressing. Add the pumpkin puree, applesauce, olive oil, maple syrup, salt, pumpkin pie spice, water and balsamic vinegar to a food processor. Process until well blended.Serve the salad in bowls. For a full serving, use  tbsp to 1 tbsp of the dressing. For a half serving, use about a teaspoon of the dressing.

steps.step: Preheat your oven to 350. Line a baking pan with aluminum foil.
Place the chopped pecans into the pan and lightly spray with cooking spray. Toss to coat.
Bake for 3 minutes and then stir.

Bake for 3 more minutes. During the last 3 minutes of baking, watch the pecans to make sure they do not start to burn. If they start to brown a lot, remove them from the oven. Once done baking, remove from he oven and set aside to cool.
Heat 1 tsp of olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
Add the baby kale to the skillet and saute for 1-2 minutes.
Remove from the skillet and set aside to cool.In a mixing bowl, toss together the wild rice, dried cranberries, pepitas, pecans and baby kale. Set aside.Make the dressing.
Add the pumpkin puree, applesauce, olive oil, maple syrup, salt, pumpkin pie spice, water and balsamic vinegar to a food processor. Process until well blended.
Serve the salad in bowls. For a full serving, use  tbsp to 1 tbsp of the dressing. For a half serving, use about a teaspoon of the dressing.
